channel.title: Terrible stuttering on steam release...
channel.description: Has anyone else been having stuttering every couple minutes when playing? It's been happening to me on both SP and MP.. Other than that I get a solid 150+ fps, so I doubt its my computer not being able to handle it. Turning on cl_forcepreload 1 helped a bit, but its still pretty bad.

item.description:
I get a lot of stuttering as well. Mostly when looking around quickly, when coming to/around a corner, when opening doors, or when a new map loads. I’ll try disabling those settings and see if that helps.

Edit: Hey, it seems to have worked so far! I haven’t had any noticeable stuttering!

But now I’m curious, is disabling those things responsible for the fact that when I blew up Magnusson’s casserole, no smoke appeared? O.o

item.title: Terrible stuttering on steam release...
item.dc:creator: Plazmatic
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

There are performance issues with explosion and muzzle flash dlights which we did not experience in all of our testing. We are looking to resolve them as soon as possible in a patch.

In the meantime, you can try a couple of things if you have stuttering or poor FPS:

From the main menu go to “Options,” click the “Black Mesa” tab, and uncheck the four boxes under “Performance.”

These options are called “Enable DLight Manager”, “Enable Muzzleflash DLight”, and “Enable Battery DLight”.

See if that helps.

I’d be wary viewing this solely as a explosion/muzzle flash issue, I have the same exact issue, however explosions/ muzzle flashes by themselves wont stutter me, but inconsistently appear to do so. I’ve also only tried the multiplayer with the current BMS released, so this might some how be related to multiplayer only in some convoluted way, which might explain why you wouldn’t have had much problem with this during testing.

My specifications are:
System:
GeForce GTX 970
Intel® Core™ i5-3470 CPU @ 3.20GHz
16 GB of DDR3 Ram
Windows 7 ultimate

item.title: Terrible stuttering on steam release...
item.dc:creator: SkyNET
item.description:
I can confirm that I noticed the same on my end.

It’s not a fps problem either (60 fps + VSync). It’s just stuttering.
I haven’t tried forcing Triple Buffering with RadeonPro yet. (It might fix it)

My PC:

Motherboard: Gigabyte Z77X-UD3H
Memory: 8 GB - G.Skill Sniper 1866mhz
CPU: Intel Core i7 3770@4.4GHz with Corsair H60 2013
GPU: AMD Radeon HD 7970 (SAPPHIRE OC with Boost Edition)
SPU: Creative Sound Blaster X-FI Titanium HD

Edit:
Ok, so, enabling Triple Buffering on RadeonPro fixed the microstering I was having.
So, guys, try that and see if it works for you.
Of course, TB includes the use of VSYNC, so you’ll have a little bit of input lag.
